![](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/o/4/eyJhaSI6NTkyMDc5NzIsImUiOiJ2aGVsbG9uQHR1cmluZy5hYy51ayIsInJpIjoiY29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSIsInJxIjoicDEtYjI0MTM2LTQxMTVjZDQ0ZWI4NTQ1MDBhMDI1YzU3NGFjMjM3YzBjIiwicGgiOm51bGx9/849aktTi9uzdTShPkCKi3w)

Click [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fm%2F1%2F59207972%2Fp1-b24136-4115cd44eb854500a025c574ac237c0c%2F1%2F88%2Fbef4f55b-63e5-4704-9bcd-9b393d2d45be&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270823679%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=H6E2WcRc7TckcAxXjZUNtdtO%2FY0qFJWEqy5yqlQq8vA%3D&reserved=0) if you are having trouble viewing this message.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

This is May's Turing-Roche newsletter! Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and wider relevant networks.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Ffc6KcOD5hn1TpsUmw-ZExQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270843532%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fv4um8OmAMRvD5db01Rq%2F1bhtOrzdI8Cw8tW8SZHLeg%3D&reserved=0) was officially launched in June 2021. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We are developing multiple research activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the broader community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FRzwWP0pJCzenjrhBHOgT7w&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270857324%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=vObHnKMyl9JVs559lNXg%2BDwp5%2Bc7N8Mml44e1rOY1bM%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Tech-Talk Event: Get more out of your workflow using VS Code

**21 May 2024**

Run by our Turing-Roche Community Scholar, Ellen Visscher, the [Tech-Talk series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2FJ54KsDU0CyPviDJHOFyCzA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270868312%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1uis%2BPgiTdwUNRExSdLguvx8tnRfgO%2B893kANEY6RDo%3D&reserved=0) aims to facilitate the exchange of technical knowledge and skills between scientists in academia and industry.

May's event will feature Carlos Gavidia-Calderon, a Research Software Engineer at the Turing Institute. In this interactive session, he will explore how VS Code can boost your productivity in computational research using Python. A focus will be on using the debugger, git integration, and navigating large codebases efficiently.

Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FrtLRV7WJUK_f0takSR3OTw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270878193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pqH%2BCgrXb%2FG0uzkQ7x75DOX0cu5HmdNPbULQmIclRYo%3D&reserved=0). 

### Translational Science Methods Club Event: Multimodal Data Integration

**23 May 2024**

Run by our Turing-Roche Community Scholar, Sarah Buehler, the [Translational Science Methods (T-SciM) Club series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2Fp0lCsbgEzIdka6Oz8CjOLQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270887511%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=27IdhFix65%2BiEOJobCTn01IdDllFXh7CmCrBm4nteKk%3D&reserved=0) aims to bring together the community to discuss different methods that help us translate from data to science to clinic.

The theme of this T-SciM event will be Multimodal Data Integration. This is central to the Turing-Roche partnership and involves exploring how we can effectively combine different modalities of data, such as from neuroimaging and genetic sources, to improve clinical disease detection and outcome prediction. The event will feature Yuhan Wang, PhD student at the Center for Robotics Research at Kings College London and Alan Turing Enrichtment student, as well as Hui Xin Ng, PhD student at UC San Diego and the Centre of Medical Image Computing at University College London.

More information and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FmcLr7m1TovRyNplx3XgCIA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270895900%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=m9LBGxrLOHhi%2Fo7mPhmcNTpsiY91vitaEAxwjXtPiHI%3D&reserved=0). 

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Geometry-Informed Data Representations

**28 May 2024**

Join us for our monthly [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FJbyg1eqMfQ_R07euuUzs4Q&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270904545%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=RLOjDPgA8ZlM1zyVDXXyK8tB%2BQJNg%2Bnvu6btCj8n%2FxE%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to hear partnership research updates and share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

May's event is on the 28th and we will be hearing from Alessandro Barp, Senior Research Associate in the Turing-Roche Partnership who will be discussing the pitfalls and limitations of modern graph embedding algorithms, particularly in the context of missing data. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FY292ysl4dh0AifjbLvBmzQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270913516%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=6l7LAjXBWMift37Z591AxZe3thjiDf5RPV8AMOW32ic%3D&reserved=0). 

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FYB20BMZwK0goGKk7PkQ1Lw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270923871%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=7%2FxjCfRheHEgXjYDNmWw4ESkbE4TjS%2F9CG9IQasc000%3D&reserved=0).

### New Partnership Research Preprints

We're excited to have two new preprints out on our partnership research. The first ['Deep Learning as Ricci Flow'](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FTgUwr-oZpCQ-_mw3IE5zSg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270934028%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=hbKCyDBA4E7d5Q0YPqsFkzk3olFt%2F%2BstqNeWaAJ%2FZvA%3D&reserved=0) presents a computational framework which quantifies geometric changes that occur as data passes through successive layers of a deep neural network. The preprint shows that the more these changes behave as a Ricci flow, the better the model is likely to generalise well beyond training data.

The second preprint ['Mining higher-order triadic interactions'](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2FvGDCg_ITpewyIj0Dl0emyQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270943889%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LY9z5n7iiVcGH9kkd2Ro1BeMU9CCxvhhAY4JOsbJD2I%3D&reserved=0) explores modelling triadic interactions, a fundamental type of higher-order interaction that occurs when one node regulates the interaction between two other nodes. The preprint also covers applying a modelling framework to gene expression data, finding new candidates for triadic interactions relevant for Acute Myeloid Leukemia.

## Current News and Opportunities from The Alan Turing Institute and Roche

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### Turing Internship Network Applications Open

**Application deadline: 12 June 2024**

**Internship begins: September 2024**

Applications have now opened for the Turing Internship Network. The scheme allows doctoral students studying any topic with a data science and/or AI focus to take part in an 3-12 month internship at Turing or with Turing's partners. For this round there are 5 paid internships on offer from HSBC, Minstry of Justice, Ofcom and the AI for Cyber Defence for Research Centre at the Turing. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FcR9_H9thD-hr1VFEHAc1jw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270953529%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=PFqvsnOfnGRzto6o6ghpJjwDrtdIuo6Ln1BCPJ3iBX8%3D&reserved=0).

### Roche Internship in Statistics

Roche are offering 4-6 month internships for masters or PhD students as part of the Data Sciences and Statistics department located in Basel, Switzerland. This department applies drug development and statistical expertise to the design and analysis of clinical development plans, clinical studies, and non-clinical experiments. More info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FZhXtJCUb6o8UIWut6CkJ2A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270962542%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=cyRkVM68kaBGgQMM0HQTcQi3PWm4MZx4Keeq5PcqyvU%3D&reserved=0).

## Events

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### Advances in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Conference

**03-04 June 2024**

The Advances in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Conference held in Manchester,  brings together researchers from across the broad fields within data science and artificial intelligence to explore the latest advances and to discuss important topical questions being posed by society around the use of data science and AI. This year, there are sessions on Natural Language Processing, AI-Fundamentals, AI for Robotics and AI for Health. To register and/or submit an abstract for a talk/poster visit [the website](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2Fht-22BIf6yd6TXCJrIE5-A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270985437%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kXjfH%2BQdDJDhL3vrYE68IEMogXuxc4p3NCIrFVCCkL0%3D&reserved=0).

### R/Medicine Conference

**10-14 June 2024**

This virtual R/Medicine conference will provide a forum for sharing R based tools and approaches used to analyse and gain insights from health data. It will feature workshops, demos, talks and a hackathon. Find out more [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2FYpTnMkbYOXiLkwi8YHzvOA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270991893%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=KqJIhed%2Bh7x%2FwFB6r8DqpefgesUiZ3i1GVRrak0Yzlw%3D&reserved=0).

### Summer School on Machine Learning for Healthcare and Biology

**11-13 June 2024**

Following the success of last year, Manchester's European Laboratory for Learning and Intelligent Systems (ELLIS) unit are hosting their second Summer School, which will bring participants up-to-speed on the latest methods and technologies in machine learning with a focus on healthcare and biology. The school includes a set of lectures by renowned researchers at the intersection of ML and Healthcare and Biology. Info and how to buy a ticket [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F2pllWZWTK8QF4mxGwPco3Q&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635270999505%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NV3ACMzOgF%2F4V15owiXrwx3ESdquPean4GXWHVe7%2Fk8%3D&reserved=0).

### Second Workshop on Multimodal AI- University of Sheffield

**Registration deadline: 10 June 2024**

**Conference: 25 June 2024**

Multimodal AI, which integrates various data modalities such as text, image, sound, and others, is swiftly revolutionising our interaction with technology and data. This workshop brings together researchers and practitioners from AI, data science, and various scientific and application domains to discuss problems and challenges, share experiences and solutions, explore collaborations and future directions, and build networks and a vibrant community on multimodal AI. More info and registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FUzw4Ar6eGoWRDGTCeLeAWw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635271009462%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Z1IGzLT%2FYO0yhhXhTdnCGlRtfPYn8JAhQqoV3VXb2B4%3D&reserved=0).

### Young Statisticians Meeting- University of Birmingham Medical School

**Registration deadline: 20 June 2024**

**Conference: 17-18 July 2024**

The Young Statisticians' Meeting is an annual two-day conference, giving students and early-career statisticians the opportunity to exhibit their work, discuss ideas, and network with their peers in a friendly and encouraging environment. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FC4b7ZMMNnYoWuqQ9sz3vcA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635271019577%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qqQb8OJKDNj5Thggbt%2FVCLTgx1LFFh7wfDsM0%2F7%2BhCA%3D&reserved=0).

## Other Opportunities

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg)

### Postdoctoral Research Assistant in AI for Health Technologies at University of Oxford
**Deadline: 31 May 2024**

The Podium Institute for Sports Medicine and Technology at the University of Oxford is looking for a Postdoctoral Research Assistant in AI for Health Technologies. The post is fixed term for 2 years and the successful applicant will be part of an interdisciplinary team of researchers, with the main aim to develop the next generation of sensing technologies and AI models to construct new personalised biomarkers of health in the context of evidence-based interdisciplinary sports injury prevention strategies. Apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2FaIMTGSGRMv0579MrXCegUQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635271028412%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=rlMyzGgEpcHJlrevNuXn4WBXWsHa3bQXwRTwiVwcoZM%3D&reserved=0).

## Featured Community Scholar of the Month
In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for 12 months to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F-oRaAHiOGaREUsMOnHZouw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635271036852%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=R6QS%2FMJwNAv5Hv3a6qXvf3gSy0Cfp6o%2BGPGJw0IKpcc%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FZZRZWttJTgWw6RniZ8_faw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635271047010%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=nxhMVw6%2B6Wv1XeXyb1kaYTSc5LvULcADqnAsF8jdlMY%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Tom Butters, from University College London.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/tom_butters.jpeg)

**Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

I am a clinical PhD student at UCL Cancer Institute with a clinical background in histopathology. I am studying the pathological context of whole genome duplication (WGD) in sarcoma. I'm looking to combine genomic analysis and image analysis to understand the development and consequences of cells which undergo WGD. 

**What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you?**

With the help of Turing-Roche colleagues Chris Banerji and Vicky Hellon, I am organising a workshop called 'AI in Pathology: Research Meets Reality' which aims to bring stakeholders from all aspects of AI research and implementation together. This includes computational scientists, research pathologists, clinicians in non-university hospitals, service managers, educationalists and others. I believe that while a lot of extremely impressive work is being done in AI and pathology, there is sometimes a disconnect between what is being developed, and the needs of real-world pathology services. I think it's also imperative that each stakeholder understands the obstacles to development and implementation of AI software in the context of the NHS so that we know how best to help each other!

**What quote resonates with you?**

'It is possible to commit no mistakes and still lose. That is not a weakness; that is life.' - I came to this TV show later in life (I'll let you guess the show), but this quote has always stuck with me - amazing!

## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

**On the genetic basis of tail-loss evolution in humans and apes**

This month's selected publication is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPU9abGxuRVdoQUJQRHVNazVEbWVIX3l4UjVjTWVQektNbzBoa29aNnBBc01ZcDRFb3JoY1NvS3g0SHlfTzJwUXQmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi01YzdiZjE0M2VhYjA0NzJjOWE3NDVlMDhmN2QzYTllZSZlc2lkPTA3OWQ2Y2IyLWQyMTEtZWYxMS05Zjg5LTAwMGQzYTdlYmIxMiJ9%2F9vxKE4fZqEhKWR2EoJUQjQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cf13fd6c96c7f4521f1b908dc74c4ab2d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638513635271057282%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=xf48DOHk22bMpaTAqddkrQo55EQ%2BYaqK5Sa%2F%2F5z7VUY%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Tom Butters.

'This paper not only provides a plausible evolutionary explanation for why we lost our tails, but also demonstrates the importance of these 'jumping genes' or transposable elements in the genome which can provide insights into our evolution and even into the development of human diseases!'
